H0.text: What name was given to Christian children forcibly recruited to serve in the Turkish army between the 14th to 19th centuries. Devshirme

H1.text: What name was given to Christian children forcibly recruited to serve in the Turkish army between the 14th to 19th centuries. Spahis

H2.text: What name was given to Christian children forcibly recruited to serve in the Turkish army between the 14th to 19th centuries. Azabs

H3.text: What name was given to Christian children forcibly recruited to serve in the Turkish army between the 14th to 19th centuries. Janisseries

A4.text: Devshirme were primarily recruited from Christians living in the Balkans.

A5.text: Boys who were orphans or were their family's only son were exempt.

A6.text: The system of forcibly recruiting Christian children was called the devşirme system.

A7.text: The devşirme system was used between the 14th and 19th centuries.
